interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2017/01/19
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Ciaran Donnelly', 'Ken Girotti'], 'Producers': ['Michael Hirst', "Morgan O'Sullivan", 'John Weber', 'James Flynn', 'Sherry Marsh', 'Alan Gasmer', 'Shelia Hockin', 'Steve Wakefield', 'Keith Thompson'], 'Starring': ['Travis Fimmel', 'Katheryn Winnick', 'Gabriel Byrne'], 'Studio': ['MGM']}
Review Text: Wow!  Each season just gets better and better.  I don't ever want it to end.  What a cast!  This is a collection of really talented athletes who act!  The characterizations are flawless.  It took me a season to get used to the quirky jerk styles of Ragnar and Loki but I am over it and have even decided that I like it, lol.  There is everything to love about season 4 that there was in 1, 2 and 3.  In fact, it might be their best performances yet.  BRAVO to the many amazing talents it takes to produce this work of art.  This will stand the test of time.
Review Title: WOW!  It jut keeps getting better
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
{'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['David Blair'], 'Producers': ['David Snodin', 'Kate Harwood'], 'Starring': ['Gemma Arterton', 'Eddie Redmayne', 'Hans Matheson'], 'Studio': ['BBC America']} All the drama and wickedness one can hope for in the long list of great British stories and productions. Certainly not your usual love story, that is for sure. So sad {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Bill Cote'], 'Producers': ['Bill Cote', 'John Cheshire', 'Carol Cote', 'Michael Gerber', 'Marianne McCune', 'Robert Watts'], 'Starring': ['GrahamHancock', 'RobertBauval', 'MichaelCremo'], 'Studio': ['UFOTV']} Oh, my. The gun loving egotist takes on science now. Creationism has been crammed down the throats of a fearful Jane and John Q Public for more than 2000 years and many a scientist and healer has been murdered by the religious elite for helping us get off our knees and participate in our world. It is the religious community who is force feeding their false doctrine, and, as they have done historically, they play the victim.
For hundreds of years, only the clergy were allowed to learn to read, write and perform experiments to better understand the nature of reality. In industrialized parts of the world, almost anyone can read now. That was a hard won fight. Religion and science don't have to be enemies. Scientists aren't calling for the end of Christianity. Simply because science doesn't support religious stories, doesn't make the scientist the bad guy here. Religion has a long history of the intentional misuse of information as it was once the major force of political power, created to keep you on your knees in service of the Lord, the King/Queen and the Pope. Much like the Middle East today, only their mind control is Islam.
Science doesn't attack religion. Religion is the bully here. Science only illuminates. Another bullying attack on scientists and sensibility. Steer clear if you value education. {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Timothy Van Patten', 'Allen Coulter', 'Jeremy Podeswa', 'Ed Bianchi', 'Brad Anderson', 'Alik Sakharov', 'Jake Paltrow', 'Simon Cellan Jones', 'Brian Kirk', 'Martin Scorsese'], 'Producers': ['Rudd Simmons', 'Terence Winter', 'Martin Scorsese', 'Tim Van Patten', 'Stephen Levinson', 'Mark Wahlberg'], 'Starring': ['Steve Buscemi', 'Michael Pitt', 'Kelly Macdonald'], 'Studio': ['HBO']} Sorry is compelling and relevant. There's an artistic quality that separates it from other stories of organized crime and government corruption setting it above the crowd. I appreciate the rather undramatic approach taken to the violence. Paired with displays of hedonistic self indulgence. It allows us to think through the event rather than just a simple viceral respnse to blood and guts. Well done! Brilliant production. {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: Low', 'English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'Español (España)', 'Italiano', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', '日本語', 'Português', 'Deutsch', 'Français'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Deutsch', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Español (España)', 'Français', 'Italiano', '日本語', 'Português'], 'Directors': ['Woody Allen'], 'Producers': ['Erika Aronson', 'Helen Robin'], 'Starring': ['Woody Allen', 'Miley Cyrus', 'Elaine May']} Still suspect about the choice of Ms. Cyrus to play the revolutionary. On the one hand, she will attract an important and large following of young minds. This would make the choice clever. On the other hand, the chemistry between the actors, which is always right on in Mr. Allen's films, is challenged by the Disney camera style that Ms. Cyrus is accustomed to. The writing is pure Allen and there are, as always, many quotable and memorable moments that make this a really fun watch for those of us who love his openly neurotic, pensive and ultimately hilarious creations. Love this one! Classic Woody Allen Prince Philip: The Plot to Make a King Documentary ['This is the inside story of the dynastic tensions that were unleashed when Princess Elizabeth, the future queen, fell in love with Prince Philip. Witness the complexities and frustrations of the royal marriage, as the monarch struggled to reconcile the love of her husband with the suspicions of her family and her government.'] {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Richard Sanders'], 'Producers': ['Richard Sanders', 'Denys Blakeway'], 'Starring': ['Tamsin Greig']} Typical, shallow documentary about an English royal. Oddly enough, I was expecting it to contain more about him: how he adapted to the seeming effeminate role of King Consort would have made it interesting. Otherwise, it is much like the pedigree of a fine stallion on film. I sense he is a far more interesting person than this documentary presented. From my recall of various events and instances where we have been given access to his thoughts and deeds he is rather hilarious in a quintessentially British way. Observant, irreverent, quick, sporting, and lets face it, absolutely DASHING; that's what I was hoping would be highlighted. This Man is FAR More Interesting Than the Documentary {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Rowan Woods', 'Tony Krawitz'], 'Producers': ['Victoria Madden', 'Vincent Sheehan', 'Andy Walker', 'Penny Win'], 'Starring': ['Elizabeth Debicki', 'Matthew Le Nevez', 'Henry Nixon']} A compelling story, complete with layers of symbols however the use of red herrings gets a bit annoying. Love the,performances and authenticity of the set. A remarkable production. Brave attempt at a complex story {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Michael Apted', 'Mikael Salomon', 'Allen Coulter', 'Alan Poul', 'Steve Shill', 'Timothy Van Patten', 'Alan Taylor', 'John Maybury', 'Julian Farino', 'Jeremy Podeswa'], 'Producers': ['Bruno Heller', 'William J. MacDonald', 'John Milius', 'Anne Thomopoulos', 'John Melfi'], 'Starring': ['Kevin McKidd', 'Ray Stevenson', 'Ciaran Hinds'], 'Studio': ['HBO']} While the characterizations are a bit contrived and stereotypical, it is highly entertaining. With excellent performances by a number of the cast members, it is more fun than illuminating or educational. I agree much of the sex is gratuitous, that seems to be pat for HBO and let's face it, it draws in the crowds. I love Ian McNiece as the herald. In fact, bravo to the casting crew! This assemblage of actors alone is well worth watching. Entertaining {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Ciaran Donnelly', 'Ken Girotti'], 'Producers': ['Michael Hirst', "Morgan O'Sullivan", 'John Weber', 'James Flynn', 'Sherry Marsh', 'Alan Gasmer', 'Shelia Hockin', 'Steve Wakefield', 'Keith Thompson'], 'Starring': ['Travis Fimmel', 'Katheryn Winnick', 'Gabriel Byrne'], 'Studio': ['MGM']} Wow! Each season just gets better and better. I don't ever want it to end. What a cast! This is a collection of really talented athletes who act! The characterizations are flawless. It took me a season to get used to the quirky jerk styles of Ragnar and Loki but I am over it and have even decided that I like it, lol. There is everything to love about season 4 that there was in 1, 2 and 3. In fact, it might be their best performances yet. BRAVO to the many amazing talents it takes to produce this work of art. This will stand the test of time. WOW! It jut keeps getting better
profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Content Preference:** The user has a robust preference for British dramas characterized by intricate narratives and emotional depth, with a particular interest in themes of organized crime, government corruption, violence, and substance use. Their recent engagement reflects an enthusiasm for productions that blend entertainment with serious storytelling, showcasing a growing appreciation for compelling characterizations despite earlier critiques regarding depth.

- **Language:** The user prefers content in English and values audio enhancements, particularly English subtitles, to enrich their viewing experience.

- **Rating Behavior:** The user rates productions with a discerning eye, typically within the 4.5 to 5.0 range. Their latest 5.0 rating highlights their enjoyment of strong performances and well-executed character arcs, even when they initially find character traits unconventional.

- **Engagement Style:** They write insightful reviews that examine emotional impact and narrative quality, effectively balancing enjoyment with critical analysis, particularly about ethical implications in storytelling.

- **Themes:** The user favors originality and darker themes over conventional romantic tropes, prioritizing authenticity in cultural discussions.

- **Favorite Elements:** They appreciate well-crafted productions from reputable directors and cast members, favoring thought-provoking content that addresses complex societal issues while continuing to express a disfavor for sensationalism and gratuitous elements.
